p: Infants <1 year of age accounted for 47 and 77% of LRTI and RSV-specific LRTI hospitalizations, respectively, among all children (Figure 1). Hospitalization rates for LRTI as the primary diagnosis among infants <1 year of age were significantly increased compared to children 1–<19 years of age (2410/100,000 population <1 year of age vs. 235/100,000 children 1–<19 years of age; P <0.0001). Bed-days rates for LRTI as the primary diagnosis were significantly increased among infants <1 year of age compared to children 1–<19 years of age (15,663/100,000 population <1year of age vs. 1473/100,000 children 1–<19 years of age; P <0.0001). Considering the bed days spent by those patients, this is an equivalent bed rate of 21.45 beds/100,000 infants <1 year of age per day and 2.02 beds/100,000 children 1–<19 years of age per day (P <0.0001).
